title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0001
text: What is the primary purpose of audit logging in microservices?

options.text: To record user and system actions for accountability and compliance

explanation: Audit logging records user and system actions to ensure accountability, traceability, and compliance.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0002
text: Which of the following best describes an audit log entry?

options.text: A record of who did what, when, and from where
A record of system performance metrics
A record of configuration changes only

explanation: An audit log entry typically includes details about who performed an action, what was done, when, and from where.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0003
text: Which of the following is a key benefit of audit logging?
explanation: Audit logs support compliance, security audits, and forensic investigations by providing detailed activity records.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0004
text: Which of the following is a common field in an audit log entry?
explanation: Each audit log entry includes a timestamp to record when the action occurred.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a common use case for audit logging?

options.text: Tracking user access and data modifications

explanation: Audit logs are used to track user access and data modifications for accountability and compliance.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a key difference between audit logs and application logs?

options.text: Audit logs focus on security and compliance, while application logs focus on debugging
Audit logs store metrics, while application logs store traces
Audit logs are temporary, while application logs are permanent

explanation: Audit logs focus on security and compliance, while application logs are used for debugging and performance monitoring.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a common standard for audit logging in cloud environments?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail is a common audit logging service that records API calls and user actions in cloud environments.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0008
text: Which of the following is a best practice for securing audit logs?

options.text: Use immutable storage and restricted access
Allow all users to modify logs

explanation: Audit logs should be stored in immutable storage with restricted access to prevent tampering.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0009
text: Which of the following is a key challenge in audit logging for microservices?
explanation: Correlating actions across distributed services is challenging due to decentralized architectures.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0010
text: Which of the following is a benefit of centralized audit logging?
explanation: Centralized audit logging simplifies compliance reporting and analysis by consolidating logs from multiple services.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a common field in an audit log schema?
explanation: User ID identifies the actor responsible for the action recorded in the audit log.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0012
text: Which of the following is a common format for audit logs?
explanation: JSON is a widely used format for audit logs due to its structured and machine-readable nature.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0013
text: Which of the following is a benefit of audit logging for security?

options.text: Detects unauthorized access and suspicious activities

explanation: Audit logs help detect unauthorized access and suspicious activities by tracking user actions.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0014
text: Which of the following is a best practice for audit log retention?

options.text: Retain logs based on compliance and business requirements
Delete logs daily to save space

explanation: Audit logs should be retained according to compliance and business requirements to balance storage and legal needs.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0015
text: Which of the following is a common challenge in audit logging performance?

options.text: High write volume impacting system performance

explanation: High write volume from frequent audit events can impact system performance if not optimized.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0016
text: Which of the following is a benefit of immutable audit logs?

options.text: Prevents tampering and ensures data integrity

explanation: Immutable audit logs prevent tampering and ensure the integrity of recorded actions.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0017
text: Which of the following is a common tool for centralized audit logging?
explanation: Elasticsearch is commonly used for centralized storage and search of audit logs.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0018
text: Which of the following is a benefit of audit logging for compliance?
explanation: Audit logs provide evidence for regulatory audits and compliance verification.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0019
text: Which of the following is a common field in an audit log entry?
explanation: Action type describes the operation performed, such as CREATE, UPDATE, or DELETE.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0020
text: Which of the following best describes the purpose of audit logging?

options.text: To record and monitor user and system actions for accountability

explanation: Audit logging records and monitors user and system actions to ensure accountability and traceability.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0021
text: Which of the following is a metric that measures the number of audit events generated per second?
explanation: Audit event rate measures how many audit events are generated per second, indicating system activity.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0022
text: Which of the following is a best practice for correlating audit logs across microservices?

options.text: Use a unique correlation or trace ID

explanation: Using a unique correlation or trace ID allows linking audit logs across multiple services for a single transaction.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0023
text: Which of the following is a common challenge in distributed audit logging?

options.text: Ensuring consistency and ordering of events

explanation: Ensuring consistency and ordering of events across distributed systems is a major challenge in audit logging.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0024

explanation: Audit logs provide detailed records that help identify the root cause of incidents.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0025

explanation: Source IP address identifies where the action originated, aiding in security analysis.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0026

explanation: Audit logging provides transparency by recording user and system actions for review.

explanation: Audit logs track who performed which actions, ensuring accountability.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0029

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0030

explanation: Audit logs help detect unauthorized access and anomalies by tracking user actions.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0031

explanation: Audit logs provide a timeline of events that can be used for forensic investigations.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0033

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0034

title: MicroservicesObservabilityAuditLogging - Q0035
